page.title: 14MR. ALLAN, GAMEKEEPER
page.content: {Mr. Allan's}duties involve trapping vermin and rearing game birds. He starts work at 6.3O a.m. and finishes at lO p.m. with an hour for lunch. He chose the job because of its solitary nature and he loves outdoor life. He traps stoats, weasels and foxes. During the shooting season there is an organized shoot of game birds each week. When rearing game birds he puts their eggs in an incubator then when they are hatched returns them to the mother birds. Mr. Allan is rarely bothered with poachers but when he is he contacts the police. He says that a person should only become a gamekeeper if they enjoy outdoor life and working on their own. Also they must be prepared to work 7 days a week.
